   Americans for Prosperity
   stated on June 18, 2012 in a campaign ad:
   Montana Democratic Sen. Jon Tester is "the largest recipient of lobbyist
   money."

true half-true
     * National
     * Campaign Finance
     * Message Machine 2012
     * Americans for Prosperity
   Louis Jacobson
   By Louis Jacobson July 10, 2012

Americans for Prosperity says Jon Tester ranked first in lobbyist donations in
the Senate

   A new TV ad shows big Montana skies and a succession of people saying
   Democratic Sen. Jon Tester isn’t representing the people the way he used
   to.

Tester’s fellow Montana senator -- Max Baucus,
   who chairs the influential Finance Committee -- received $513,169.

Our ruling

   Americans for Prosperity claimed that Tester is "the largest recipient of
   lobbyist money" in the Senate, and it provided as backup a chart from a
   credible, independent organization showing Tester topping the list.
